attributes.action: Reduce the costs of public transport for whose living in London.
attributes.additional_details: It’s not fair for those who are resident living in the London to pay the same amount of tourists. Loads of people using tubes are forced to spend all the salary on public transports.
attributes.background: The costs of the ticket for buses and tubes should be reduce for whose is resident/living in London

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

We can't accept your petition because the UK Government aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Decisions about public transport in London are a matter for the London Assembly and the London Mayor, not the UK Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
